intro: Cacalia shirensis, commonly known as the Shirensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features showy, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Cacalia shirensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open habitats.
